# Draft:Kara King

----
Kara King is an American public official serving as the mayor of Bee Cave, Texas. She was first elected to the city council in 2013 and became mayor in 2020.*.
In October 2025, King announced that she would seek election to the United States House of Representatives in Texas's 10th congressional district, a seat then held by Michael McCaul.
Early life and education
King earned a degree in biomedical science from Texas A&M University.
Before entering politics, she worked as a middle-school science teacher.
Political career
King was elected to the Bee Cave City Council in 2013 and later became mayor in 2020.
She won re-election in 2022 with about 75 percent of the vote.
As mayor, King has been mentioned in regional news coverage for infrastructure projects and local development decisions. In August 2024 the city council of Bee Cave voted to file a lawsuit to stop the proposed KBC Service Center distribution facility, a decision covered in local media.
